question.title: Building and running Micrometer with Java 25
question.body:
We're trying to verify that Micrometer runs on JDK 25, but when I try to build it (Mac OS, OpenJDK Runtime Environment Temurin-25.0.1+8), I get

BUG! exception in phase 'semantic analysis' in source unit '_BuildScript_' Unsupported class file major version 69
> Unsupported class file major version 69

And then I see this in the tracker, so I'm clearly missing something. What does JDK 25 support look like for Micrometer?

answers.body:
We found this same issue between a very new gradle version and Java 25, modify the gradle version. There are several issues about this

https://github.com/gradle/gradle/issues/35062

This is because Micrometer is using Gradle 8.14 (due to a plugin dependency) at the moment which is not Java 25 compatible to run Gradle, see Gradle#35111.

It seems Gradle 8.14 is not officially Java 25 compatible to compile either, see Compatibility Matrix.

But I was able to run ./gradlew build successfully (compiling with Java 25):

  1. Have Java 24 and 25 installed and set Java 24 as "default" (check ./gradlew --version for "Launcher JVM")
  2. Modify the second line of Micrometer's root build.gradle:
ext.javaLanguageVersion = JavaLanguageVersion.of(25)
  1. Run ./gradlew build

This should result in Gradle running using Java 24 but it will use Java 25 to compile and run the tests. You can follow the Gradle 9 migration effort here: Micrometer#6829.
